00002 $class=get_class($model);
00003 Yii::app()->clientScript->registerScript('gii.model',"
00004 $('#{$class}_modelClass').change(function(){
00005     $(this).data('changed',$(this).val()!='');
00006 });
00007 $('#{$class}_tableName').bind('keyup change', function(){
00008     var model=$('#{$class}_modelClass');
00009     var tableName=$(this).val();
00010     if(tableName.substring(tableName.length-1)!='*') {
00011         $('.form .row.model-class').show();
00012     }
00013     else {
00014         $('#{$class}_modelClass').val('');
00015         $('.form .row.model-class').hide();
00016     }
00017     if(!model.data('changed')) {
00018         var i=tableName.lastIndexOf('.');
00019         if(i>=0)
00020             tableName=tableName.substring(i+1);
00021         var tablePrefix=$('#{$class}_tablePrefix').val();
00022         if(tablePrefix!='' && tableName.indexOf(tablePrefix)==0)
00023             tableName=tableName.substring(tablePrefix.length);
00024         var modelClass='';
00025         $.each(tableName.split('_'), function() {
00026             if(this.length>0)
00027                 modelClass+=this.substring(0,1).toUpperCase()+this.substring(1);
00028         });
00029         model.val(modelClass);
00030     }
00031 });
00032 $('.form .row.model-class').toggle($('#{$class}_tableName').val().substring($('#{$class}_tableName').val().length-1)!='*');
00033 ");

00036 
00037 <p>This generator generates a model class for the specified database table.</p>

00041     <div class="row sticky">
00042         <?php echo $form->labelEx($model,'databaseComponent'); ?>

00051         <?php echo $form->textField($model,'tablePrefix', array('size'=>65)); ?>
00052         <div class="tooltip">
00053         This refers to the prefix name that is shared by all database tables.
00054         Setting this property mainly affects how model classes are named based on
00055         the table names. For example, a table prefix <code>tbl_</code> with a table name <code>tbl_post</code>
00056         will generate a model class named <code>Post</code>.
00057         <br/>
00058         Leave this field empty if your database tables do not use common prefix.
00059         </div>
00060         <?php echo $form->error($model,'tablePrefix'); ?>
00061     </div>

00063         <?php echo $form->labelEx($model,'tableName'); ?>
00064         <?php echo $form->textField($model,'tableName', array('size'=>65)); ?>
00065         <div class="tooltip">
00066         This refers to the table name that a new model class should be generated for
00067         (e.g. <code>tbl_user</code>). It can contain schema name, if needed (e.g. <code>public.tbl_post</code>).
00068         You may also enter <code>*</code> (or <code>schemaName.*</code> for a particular DB schema)
00069         to generate a model class for EVERY table.
00070         </div>
00071         <?php echo $form->error($model,'tableName'); ?>
00072     </div>

00078         It is case-sensitive.
00079         </div>
